013package org.apache.juneau.rest.client;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.IOUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.StringUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.ThrowableUtils.*;
018
019import java.io.*;
020import java.lang.reflect.*;
021import java.nio.charset.*;
022import java.util.concurrent.*;
023import java.util.regex.*;
024
025import org.apache.http.*;
026import org.apache.http.conn.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.assertions.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.http.entity.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.http.resource.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.httppart.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.oapi.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
037import org.apache.juneau.parser.ParseException;
038import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
039import org.apache.juneau.rest.client.assertion.*;
040
041/**
042 * Represents the body of an HTTP response.
043 *
044 * <p>
045 * An extension of an HttpClient {@link HttpEntity} that provides various support for converting the body to POJOs and
046 * other convenience methods.
047 *
048 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
049 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestClientBasics">juneau-rest-client Basics</a>
050 * </ul>
051 */
052public class ResponseContent implements HttpEntity {
053
054   private static final HttpEntity NULL_ENTITY = new HttpEntity() {
055
056      @Override
057      public boolean isRepeatable() {
058         return false;
059      }
060
061      @Override
062      public boolean isChunked() {
063         return false;
064      }
065
066      @Override
067      public long getContentLength() {
068         return -1;
069      }
070
071      @Override
072      public Header getContentType() {
073         return ResponseHeader.NULL_HEADER;
074      }
075
076      @Override
077      public Header getContentEncoding() {
078         return ResponseHeader.NULL_HEADER;
079      }
080
081      @Override
082      public InputStream getContent() throws IOException, UnsupportedOperationException {
083         return new ByteArrayInputStream(new byte[0]);
084      }
085
086      @Override
087      public void writeTo(OutputStream outstream) throws IOException {}
088
089      @Override
090      public boolean isStreaming() {
091         return false;
092      }
093
094      @Override
095      public void consumeContent() throws IOException {}
096   };
097
098   private final RestClient client;
099   final RestRequest request;
100   final RestResponse response;
101   private final HttpEntity entity;
102   private HttpPartSchema schema;
103   private Parser parser;
104   private byte[] body;
105   private boolean cached;
106   boolean isConsumed;
107
108   /**
109    * Constructor.
110    *
111    * @param client The client used to build this request.
112    * @param request The request object.
113    * @param response The response object.
114    * @param parser The parser to use to consume the body.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
115    */
116   public ResponseContent(RestClient client, RestRequest request, RestResponse response, Parser parser) {
117      this.client = client;
118      this.request = request;
119      this.response = response;
120      this.parser = parser;
121      this.entity = Utils.firstNonNull(response.asHttpResponse().getEntity(), NULL_ENTITY);
122   }
123
124   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
125   // Setters
126   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
127
128   /**
129    * Specifies the parser to use for this body.
130    *
131    * <p>
132    * If not specified, uses the parser defined on the client set via {@link RestClient.Builder#parser(Class)}.
133    *
134    * @param value
135    *    The new part parser to use for this body.
136    * @return This object.
137    */
138   public ResponseContent parser(Parser value) {
139      this.parser = value;
140      return this;
141   }
142
143   /**
144    * Specifies the schema for this body.
145    *
146    * <p>
147    * Used by schema-based parsers such as {@link OpenApiParser}.
148    *
149    * @param value The schema.
150    * @return This object.
151    */
152   public ResponseContent schema(HttpPartSchema value) {
153      this.schema = value;
154      return this;
155   }
156
157   /**
158    * Causes the contents of the response body to be stored so that it can be repeatedly read.
159    *
160    * <p>
161    * Calling this method allows methods that read the response body to be called multiple times.
162    *
163    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
164    *    <li class='note'>
165    *       Multiple calls to this method are ignored.
166    * </ul>
167    *
168    * @return This object.
169    */
170   public ResponseContent cache() {
171      this.cached = true;
172      return this;
173   }
174
175   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
176   // Raw streams
177   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
178
179   /**
180    * Returns the HTTP response message body as an input stream.
181    *
182    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
183    *    <li class='note'>
184    *       Once this input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
185    *  <li class='note'>
186    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
187    *  <li class='note'>
188    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
189    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
190    * </ul>
191    *
192    * @return
193    *    The HTTP response message body input stream, never <jk>null</jk>.
194    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty stream.
195    * @throws IOException If a stream or illegal state exception was thrown.
196    */
197   @SuppressWarnings("resource")
198   public InputStream asInputStream() throws IOException {
199      try {
200         if (body != null)
201            return new ByteArrayInputStream(body);
202
203         if (cached) {
204            body = readBytes(entity.getContent());
205            response.close();
206            return new ByteArrayInputStream(body);
207         }
208
209         if (isConsumed && ! entity.isRepeatable())
210            throw new IllegalStateException("Method cannot be called.  Response has already been consumed.  Consider using the RestResponse.cacheBody() method.");
211
212         HttpEntity e = response.asHttpResponse().getEntity();
213         InputStream is = e == null ? new ByteArrayInputStream(new byte[0]) : e.getContent();
214
215         is = new EofSensorInputStream(is, new EofSensorWatcher() {
216            @Override
217            public boolean eofDetected(InputStream wrapped) throws IOException {
218               try {
219                  response.close();
220               } catch (RestCallException e) {}
221               return true;
222            }
223            @Override
224            public boolean streamClosed(InputStream wrapped) throws IOException {
225               try {
226                  response.close();
227               } catch (RestCallException e) {}
228               return true;
229            }
230            @Override
231            public boolean streamAbort(InputStream wrapped) throws IOException {
232               try {
233                  response.close();
234               } catch (RestCallException e) {}
235               return true;
236            }
237         });
238
239         isConsumed = true;
240
241         return is;
242      } catch (UnsupportedOperationException | RestCallException e) {
243         throw new IOException(e);
244      }
245   }
246
247   /**
248    * Returns the HTTP response message body as a reader based on the charset on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header.
249    *
250    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
251    *    <li class='note'>
252    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
253    *    <li class='note'>
254    *       Once this input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
255    *  <li class='note'>
256    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
257    *  <li class='note'>
258    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
259    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
260    * </ul>
261    *
262    * @return
263    *    The HTTP response message body reader, never <jk>null</jk>.
264    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty reader.
265    * @throws IOException If an exception occurred.
266    */
267   public Reader asReader() throws IOException {
268
269      // Figure out what the charset of the response is.
270      String cs = null;
271      String ct = getContentType().orElse(null);
272
273      // First look for "charset=" in Content-Type header of response.
274      if (ct != null)
275         if (ct.contains("charset="))
276            cs = ct.substring(ct.indexOf("charset=")+8).trim();
277
278      return asReader(cs == null ? IOUtils.UTF8 : Charset.forName(cs));
279   }
280
281   /**
282    * Returns the HTTP response message body as a reader using the specified charset.
283    *
284    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
285    *    <li class='note'>
286    *       Once this input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
287    *  <li class='note'>
288    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
289    *  <li class='note'>
290    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
291    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
292    * </ul>
293    *
294    * @param charset
295    *    The charset to use for the reader.
296    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is used.
297    * @return
298    *    The HTTP response message body reader, never <jk>null</jk>.
299    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty reader.
300    * @throws IOException If an exception occurred.
301    */
302   public Reader asReader(Charset charset) throws IOException {
303      return new InputStreamReader(asInputStream(), charset == null ? IOUtils.UTF8 : charset);
304   }
305
306   /**
307    * Returns the HTTP response message body as a byte array.
308    *
309    *    The HTTP response message body reader, never <jk>null</jk>.
310    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty array.
311    *
312    * @return The HTTP response body as a byte array.
313    * @throws RestCallException If an exception occurred.
314    */
315   public byte[] asBytes() throws RestCallException {
316      if (body == null) {
317         try {
318            if (entity instanceof BasicHttpEntity) {
319               body = ((BasicHttpEntity)entity).asBytes();
320            } else {
321               body = readBytes(entity.getContent());
322            }
323         } catch (IOException e) {
324            throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Could not read response body.");
325         } finally {
326            response.close();
327         }
328      }
329      return body;
330   }
331
332
333   /**
334    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified output stream.
335    *
336    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
337    * <li class='note'>
338    *    The output stream is not automatically closed.
339    *    <li class='note'>
340    *       Once the input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
341    *  <li class='note'>
342    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
343    *  <li class='note'>
344    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
345    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
346    * </ul>
347    *
348    * @param os The output stream to pipe the output to.
349    * @return This object.
350    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
351    */
352   public RestResponse pipeTo(OutputStream os) throws IOException {
353      pipe(asInputStream(), os);
354      return response;
355   }
356
357   /**
358    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
359    *
360    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
361    * <li class='note'>
362    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
363    *    <li class='note'>
364    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
365    *    <li class='note'>
366    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
367    *  <li class='note'>
368    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
369    *  <li class='note'>
370    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
371    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
372    * </ul>
373    *
374    * @param w The writer to pipe the output to.
375    * @return This object.
376    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
377    */
378   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w) throws IOException {
379      return pipeTo(w, false);
380   }
381
382   /**
383    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
384    *
385    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
386    * <li class='note'>
387    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
388    *    <li class='note'>
389    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
390    *  <li class='note'>
391    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
392    *  <li class='note'>
393    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
394    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
395    * </ul>
396    *
397    * @param w The writer to pipe the output to.
398    * @param charset
399    *    The charset to use for the reader.
400    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is used.
401    * @return This object.
402    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
403    */
404   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w, Charset charset) throws IOException {
405      return pipeTo(w, charset, false);
406   }
407
408   /**
409    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
410    *
411    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
412    * <li class='note'>
413    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
414    *    <li class='note'>
415    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
416    *    <li class='note'>
417    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
418    *  <li class='note'>
419    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
420    *  <li class='note'>
421    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
422    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
423    * </ul>
424    *
425    * @param w The writer to write the output to.
426    * @param byLines Flush the writers after every line of output.
427    * @return This object.
428    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
429    */
430   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w, boolean byLines) throws IOException {
431      return pipeTo(w, null, byLines);
432   }
433
434   /**
435    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
436    *
437    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
438    * <li class='note'>
439    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
440    *    <li class='note'>
441    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
442    *  <li class='note'>
443    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
444    *  <li class='note'>
445    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
446    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
447    * </ul>
448    *
449    * @param w The writer to pipe the output to.
450    * @param byLines Flush the writers after every line of output.
451    * @param charset
452    *    The charset to use for the reader.
453    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is used.
454    * @return This object.
455    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
456    */
457   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w, Charset charset, boolean byLines) throws IOException {
458      if (byLines)
459         pipeLines(asReader(charset), w);
460      else
461         pipe(asReader(charset), w);
462      return response;
463   }
464
465   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
466   // Retrievers
467   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
468
469   /**
470    * Parses HTTP body into the specified object type.
471    *
472    * <p>
473    * The type can be a simple type (e.g. beans, strings, numbers) or parameterized type (collections/maps).
474    *
475    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
476    * <p class='bjava'>
477    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of strings.</jc>
478    *    List&lt;String&gt; <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
479    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
480    *       .run()
481    *       .getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
482    *
483    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of beans.</jc>
484    *    List&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
485    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
486    *       .run()
487    *       .getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
488    *
489    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
490    *    List&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
491    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
492    *       .run()
493    *       .getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
494    *
495    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of string keys/values.</jc>
496    *    Map&lt;String,String&gt; <jv>map1</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
497    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
498    *       .run()
499    *       .getContent().as(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
500    *
501    *    <jc>// Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
502    *    Map&lt;String,List&lt;MyBean&gt;&gt; <jv>map2</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
503    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
504    *       .run()
505    *       .getContent().as(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
506    * </p>
507    *
508    * <p>
509    * <c>Collection</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or one objects indicating the element type.
510    *
511    * <p>
512    * <c>Map</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value types.
513    *
514    * <p>
515    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
516    *
517    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
518    *    <li class='note'>
519    *       Use the {@link #as(Class)} method instead if you don't need a parameterized map/collection.
520    *    <li class='note'>
521    *       You can also specify any of the following types:
522    *       <ul class='compact'>
523    *          <li>{@link ResponseContent}/{@link HttpEntity} - Returns access to this object.
524    *          <li>{@link Reader} - Returns access to the raw reader of the response.
525    *          <li>{@link InputStream} - Returns access to the raw input stream of the response.
526    *          <li>{@link HttpResource} - Response will be converted to an {@link BasicResource}.
527    *          <li>Any type that takes in an {@link HttpResponse} object.
528    *       </ul>
529    *    <li class='note'>
530    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
531    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
532    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
533    *    <li class='note'>
534    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
535    * </ul>
536    *
537    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
538    * @param type
539    *    The object type to create.
540    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
541    * @param args
542    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
543    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
544    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
545    * @return The parsed object.
546    * @throws RestCallException
547    *    <ul>
548    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
549    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
550    *    </ul>
551    * @see BeanSession#getClassMeta(Class) for argument syntax for maps and collections.
552    */
553   public <T> T as(Type type, Type...args) throws RestCallException {
554      return as(getClassMeta(type, args));
555   }
556
557   /**
558    * Same as {@link #as(Type,Type...)} except optimized for a non-parameterized class.
559    *
560    * <p>
561    * This is the preferred parse method for simple types since you don't need to cast the results.
562    *
563    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
564    * <p class='bjava'>
565    *    <jc>// Parse into a string.</jc>
566    *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(String.<jk>class</jk>);
567    *
568    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean.</jc>
569    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
570    *
571    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean array.</jc>
572    *    MyBean[] <jv>beanArray</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(MyBean[].<jk>class</jk>);
573    *
574    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of objects.</jc>
575    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>);
576    *
577    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of object keys/values.</jc>
578    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>);
579    * </p>
580    *
581    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
582    *    <li class='note'>
583    *       You can also specify any of the following types:
584    *       <ul class='compact'>
585    *          <li>{@link ResponseContent}/{@link HttpEntity} - Returns access to this object.
586    *          <li>{@link Reader} - Returns access to the raw reader of the response.
587    *          <li>{@link InputStream} - Returns access to the raw input stream of the response.
588    *          <li>{@link HttpResource} - Response will be converted to an {@link BasicResource}.
589    *          <li>Any type that takes in an {@link HttpResponse} object.
590    *       </ul>
591    *    <li class='note'>
592    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
593    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
594    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
595    *    <li class='note'>
596    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
597    * </ul>
598    *
599    * @param <T>
600    *    The class type of the object being created.
601    *    See {@link #as(Type,Type...)} for details.
602    * @param type The object type to create.
603    * @return The parsed object.
604    * @throws RestCallException
605    *    If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type, or if a connection
606    *    error occurred.
607    */
608   public <T> T as(Class<T> type) throws RestCallException {
609      return as(getClassMeta(type));
610   }
611
612   /**
613    * Same as {@link #as(Class)} except allows you to predefine complex data types using the {@link ClassMeta} API.
614    *
615    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
616    * <p class='bjava'>
617    *    BeanContext <jv>beanContext</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>;
618    *
619    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of strings.</jc>
620    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm1</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
621    *    List&lt;String&gt; <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm1</jv>);
622    *
623    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of beans.</jc>
624    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm2</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
625    *    List&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm2</jv>);
626    *
627    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
628    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm3</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
629    *    List&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm3</jv>);
630    *
631    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of string keys/values.</jc>
632    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm4</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
633    *    Map&lt;String,String&gt; <jv>map4</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm4</jv>);
634    *
635    *    <jc>// Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
636    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm5</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
637    *    Map&lt;String,List&lt;MyBean&gt;&gt; <jv>map5</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm5</jv>);
638    * </p>
639    *
640    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
641    *    <li class='note'>
642    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
643    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
644    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
645    *    <li class='note'>
646    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
647    * </ul>
648    *
649    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
650    * @param type The object type to create.
651    * @return The parsed object.
652    * @throws RestCallException
653    *    <ul>
654    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
655    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
656    *    </ul>
657    * @see BeanSession#getClassMeta(Class) for argument syntax for maps and collections.
658    */
659   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
660   public <T> T as(ClassMeta<T> type) throws RestCallException {
661      try {
662         if (type.is(ResponseContent.class) || type.is(HttpEntity.class))
663            return (T)this;
664
665         if (type.is(Reader.class))
666            return (T)asReader();
667
668         if (type.is(InputStream.class))
669            return (T)asInputStream();
670
671         if (type.is(HttpResponse.class))
672            return (T)response;
673
674         if (type.is(HttpResource.class))
675            type = (ClassMeta<T>)getClassMeta(BasicResource.class);
676
677         ConstructorInfo ci = type.getInfo().getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(HttpResponse.class));
678         if (ci != null) {
679            try {
680               return (T)ci.invoke(response);
681            } catch (ExecutableException e) {
682               throw asRuntimeException(e);
683            }
684         }
685
686         String ct = firstNonEmpty(response.getHeader("Content-Type").orElse("text/plain"));
687
688         if (parser == null)
689            parser = client.getMatchingParser(ct);
690
691         MediaType mt = MediaType.of(ct);
692
693         if (parser == null || (mt.toString().contains("text/plain") && ! parser.canHandle(ct))) {
694            if (type.hasStringMutater())
695               return type.getStringMutater().mutate(asString());
696         }
697
698         if (parser != null) {
699            try (Closeable in = parser.isReaderParser() ? asReader() : asInputStream()) {
700
701               T t = parser
702                  .createSession()
703                  .properties(JsonMap.create().inner(request.getSessionProperties()))
704                  .locale(response.getLocale())
705                  .mediaType(mt)
706                  .schema(schema)
707                  .build()
708                  .parse(in, type);
709
710               // Some HTTP responses have no body, so try to create these beans if they've got no-arg constructors.
711               if (t == null && ! type.is(String.class)) {
712                  ConstructorInfo c = type.getInfo().getPublicConstructor(ConstructorInfo::hasNoParams);
713                  if (c != null) {
714                     try {
715                        return c.<T>invoke();
716                     } catch (ExecutableException e) {
717                        throw new ParseException(e);
718                     }
719                  }
720               }
721
722               return t;
723            }
724         }
725
726         if (type.hasReaderMutater())
727            return type.getReaderMutater().mutate(asReader());
728
729         if (type.hasInputStreamMutater())
730            return type.getInputStreamMutater().mutate(asInputStream());
731
732         ct = response.getStringHeader("Content-Type").orElse(null);
733
734         if (ct == null && client.hasParsers())
735            throw new ParseException("Content-Type not specified in response header.  Cannot find appropriate parser.");
736
737         throw new ParseException("Unsupported media-type in request header ''Content-Type'': ''{0}''", ct);
738
739      } catch (ParseException | IOException e) {
740         response.close();
741         throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Could not parse response body.");
742      }
743   }
744
745   /**
746    * Same as {@link #as(Class)} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
747    *
748    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
749    *    <li class='note'>
750    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
751    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
752    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
753    *    <li class='note'>
754    *       The input stream is automatically closed after the execution of the future.
755    * </ul>
756    *
757    * @param <T> The class type of the object being created.
758    * @param type The object type to create.
759    * @return The future object.
760    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
761    * @see
762    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
763    *    {@link Future Futures}.
764    */
765    public <T> Future<T> asFuture(final Class<T> type) throws RestCallException {
766        return client.getExecutorService().submit(() -> as(type));
767    }
768
769   /**
770    * Same as {@link #as(ClassMeta)} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
771    *
772    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
773    *    <li class='note'>
774    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
775    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
776    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
777    *    <li class='note'>
778    *       The input stream is automatically closed after the execution of the future.
779    * </ul>
780    *
781    * @param <T>
782    *    The class type of the object being created.
783    *    See {@link #as(Type, Type...)} for details.
784    * @param type The object type to create.
785    * @return The future object.
786    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
787    * @see
788    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
789    *    {@link Future Futures}.
790    */
791    public <T> Future<T> asFuture(final ClassMeta<T> type) throws RestCallException {
792        return client.getExecutorService().submit(() -> as(type));
793    }
794
795   /**
796    * Same as {@link #as(Type,Type...)} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
797    *
798    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
799    *    <li class='note'>
800    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
801    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
802    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
803    *    <li class='note'>
804    *       The input stream is automatically closed after the execution of the future.
805    * </ul>
806    *
807    * @param <T>
808    *    The class type of the object being created.
809    *    See {@link #as(Type, Type...)} for details.
810    * @param type
811    *    The object type to create.
812    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
813    * @param args
814    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
815    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
816    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
817    * @return The future object.
818    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
819    * @see
820    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
821    *    {@link Future Futures}.
822    */
823    public <T> Future<T> asFuture(final Type type, final Type... args) throws RestCallException {
824        return client.getExecutorService().submit(() -> as(type, args));
825    }
826
827   /**
828    * Returns the contents of this body as a string.
829    *
830    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
831    *    <li class='note'>
832    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
833    *  <li class='note'>
834    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
835    *    <li class='note'>
836    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
837    * </ul>
838    *
839    * @return The response as a string.
840    * @throws RestCallException
841    *    <ul>
842    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
843    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
844    *    </ul>
845    */
846   public String asString() throws RestCallException {
847      cache();
848      try (Reader r = asReader()) {
849         return read(r);
850      } catch (IOException e) {
851         response.close();
852         throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Could not read response body.");
853      }
854   }
855
856   /**
857    * Same as {@link #asString()} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
858    *
859    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
860    *    <li class='note'>
861    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
862    *  <li class='note'>
863    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
864    *    <li class='note'>
865    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
866    * </ul>
867    *
868    * @return The future object.
869    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
870    * @see
871    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
872    *    {@link Future Futures}.
873    */
874    public Future<String> asStringFuture() throws RestCallException {
875        return client.getExecutorService().submit(this::asString);
876    }
877
878   /**
879    * Same as {@link #asString()} but truncates the string to the specified length.
880    *
881    * <p>
882    * If truncation occurs, the string will be suffixed with <js>"..."</js>.
883    *
884    * @param length The max length of the returned string.
885    * @return The truncated string.
886    * @throws RestCallException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
887    */
888   public String asAbbreviatedString(int length) throws RestCallException {
889      return StringUtils.abbreviate(asString(), length);
890   }
891
892   /**
893    * Returns the HTTP body content as a simple hexadecimal character string.
894    *
895    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
896    * <p class='bcode'>
897    *    0123456789ABCDEF
898    * </p>
899    *
900    * @return The incoming input from the connection as a plain string.
901    * @throws RestCallException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
902    */
903   public String asHex() throws RestCallException {
904      return toHex(asBytes());
905   }
906
907   /**
908    * Returns the HTTP body content as a simple space-delimited hexadecimal character string.
909    *
910    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
911    * <p class='bcode'>
912    *    01 23 45 67 89 AB CD EF
913    * </p>
914    *
915    * @return The incoming input from the connection as a plain string.
916    * @throws RestCallException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
917    */
918   public String asSpacedHex() throws RestCallException {
919      return toSpacedHex(asBytes());
920   }
921
922   /**
923    * Parses the output from the body into the specified type and then wraps that in a {@link ObjectRest}.
924    *
925    * <p>
926    * Useful if you want to quickly retrieve a single value from inside of a larger JSON document.
927    *
928    * @param innerType The class type of the POJO being wrapped.
929    * @return The parsed output wrapped in a {@link ObjectRest}.
930    * @throws RestCallException
931    *    <ul>
932    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
933    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
934    *    </ul>
935    */
936   public ObjectRest asObjectRest(Class<?> innerType) throws RestCallException {
937      return new ObjectRest(as(innerType));
938   }
939
940   /**
941    * Converts the output from the connection into an {@link JsonMap} and then wraps that in a {@link ObjectRest}.
942    *
943    * <p>
944    * Useful if you want to quickly retrieve a single value from inside of a larger JSON document.
945    *
946    * @return The parsed output wrapped in a {@link ObjectRest}.
947    * @throws RestCallException
948    *    <ul>
949    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
950    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
951    *    </ul>
952    */
953   public ObjectRest asObjectRest() throws RestCallException {
954      return asObjectRest(JsonMap.class);
955   }
956
957   /**
958    * Converts the contents of the response body to a string and then matches the specified pattern against it.
959    *
960    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
961    * <p class='bjava'>
962    *    <jc>// Parse response using a regular expression.</jc>
963    *    Matcher <jv>matcher</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
964    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
965    *       .run()
966    *       .getContent().asMatcher(Pattern.<jsm>compile</jsm>(<js>"foo=(.*)"</js>));
967    *
968    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>matcher</jv>.matches()) {
969    *       String <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>matcher</jv>.group(1);
970    *    }
971    * </p>
972    *
973    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
974    *    <li class='note'>
975    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
976    *  <li class='note'>
977    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
978    *    <li class='note'>
979    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
980    * </ul>
981    *
982    * @param pattern The regular expression pattern to match.
983    * @return The matcher.
984    * @throws RestCallException If a connection error occurred.
985    */
986   public Matcher asMatcher(Pattern pattern) throws RestCallException {
987      return pattern.matcher(asString());
988   }
989
990   /**
991    * Converts the contents of the response body to a string and then matches the specified pattern against it.
992    *
993    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
994    * <p class='bjava'>
995    *    <jc>// Parse response using a regular expression.</jc>
996    *    Matcher <jv>matcher</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
997    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
998    *       .run()
999    *       .getContent().asMatcher(<js>"foo=(.*)"</js>);
1000    *
1001    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>matcher</jv>.matches()) {
1002    *       String <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>matcher</jv>.group(1);
1003    *    }
1004    * </p>
1005    *
1006    *
1007    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1008    *    <li class='note'>
1009    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1010    *  <li class='note'>
1011    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
1012    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
1013    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
1014    *    <li class='note'>
1015    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1016    * </ul>
1017    *
1018    * @param regex The regular expression pattern to match.
1019    * @return The matcher.
1020    * @throws RestCallException If a connection error occurred.
1021    */
1022   public Matcher asMatcher(String regex) throws RestCallException {
1023      return asMatcher(regex, 0);
1024   }
1025
1026   /**
1027    * Converts the contents of the response body to a string and then matches the specified pattern against it.
1028    *
1029    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1030    * <p class='bjava'>
1031    *    <jc>// Parse response using a regular expression.</jc>
1032    *    Matcher <jv>matcher</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
1033    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1034    *       .run()
1035    *       .getContent().asMatcher(<js>"foo=(.*)"</js>, <jsf>MULTILINE</jsf> &amp; <jsf>CASE_INSENSITIVE</jsf>);
1036    *
1037    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>matcher</jv>.matches()) {
1038    *       String <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>matcher</jv>.group(1);
1039    *    }
1040    * </p>
1041    *
1042    *
1043    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1044    *    <li class='note'>
1045    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1046    *  <li class='note'>
1047    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
1048    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
1049    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
1050    *    <li class='note'>
1051    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1052    * </ul>
1053    *
1054    * @param regex The regular expression pattern to match.
1055    * @param flags Pattern match flags.  See {@link Pattern#compile(String, int)}.
1056    * @return The matcher.
1057    * @throws RestCallException If a connection error occurred.
1058    */
1059   public Matcher asMatcher(String regex, int flags) throws RestCallException {
1060      return asMatcher(Pattern.compile(regex, flags));
1061   }
1062
1063   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1064   // Assertions
1065   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1066
1067   /**
1068    * Provides the ability to perform fluent-style assertions on this response body.
1069    *
1070    * <p>
1071    * This method is called directly from the {@link RestResponse#assertContent()} method to instantiate a fluent assertions object.
1072    *
1073    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
1074    * <p class='bjava'>
1075    *    <jc>// Validates the response body equals the text "OK".</jc>
1076    *    <jv>client</jv>
1077    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1078    *       .run()
1079    *       .getContent().assertValue().equals(<js>"OK"</js>);
1080    *
1081    *    <jc>// Validates the response body contains the text "OK".</jc>
1082    *    <jv>client</jv>
1083    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1084    *       .run()
1085    *       .getContent().assertValue().contains(<js>"OK"</js>);
1086    *
1087    *    <jc>// Validates the response body passes a predicate test.</jc>
1088    *    <jv>client</jv>
1089    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1090    *       .run()
1091    *       .getContent().assertValue().is(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv>.contains(<js>"OK"</js>));
1092    *
1093    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression.</jc>
1094    *    <jv>client</jv>
1095    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1096    *       .run()
1097    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<js>".*OK.*"</js>);
1098    *
1099    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression using regex flags.</jc>
1100    *    <jv>client</jv>
1101    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1102    *       .run()
1103    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<js>".*OK.*"</js>,  <jsf>MULTILINE</jsf> &amp; <jsf>CASE_INSENSITIVE</jsf>);
1104    *
1105    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression in the form of an existing Pattern.</jc>
1106    *    Pattern <jv>pattern</jv> = Pattern.<jsm>compile</jsm>(<js>".*OK.*"</js>);
1107    *    <jv>client</jv>
1108    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1109    *       .run()
1110    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<jv>pattern</jv>);
1111    * </p>
1112    *
1113    * <p>
1114    * The assertion test returns the original response object allowing you to chain multiple requests like so:
1115    * <p class='bjava'>
1116    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression.</jc>
1117    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
1118    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1119    *       .run()
1120    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<js>".*OK.*"</js>);
1121    *       .getContent().assertValue().isNotPattern(<js>".*ERROR.*"</js>)
1122    *       .getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
1123    * </p>
1124    *
1125    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1126    *    <li class='note'>
1127    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1128    *  <li class='note'>
1129    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
1130    *    <li class='note'>
1131    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1132    * </ul>
1133    *
1134    * @return A new fluent assertion object.
1135    */
1136   public FluentResponseBodyAssertion<ResponseContent> assertValue() {
1137      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this);
1138   }
1139
1140   /**
1141    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().asString()</c>.
1142    *
1143    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1144    */
1145   public FluentStringAssertion<ResponseContent> assertString() {
1146      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).asString();
1147   }
1148
1149   /**
1150    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().asBytes()</c>.
1151    *
1152    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1153    */
1154   public FluentByteArrayAssertion<ResponseContent> assertBytes() {
1155      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).asBytes();
1156   }
1157
1158   /**
1159    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().as(<jv>type</jv>)</c>.
1160    *
1161    * @param <T> The object type to create.
1162    * @param type The object type to create.
1163    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1164    */
1165   public <T> FluentAnyAssertion<T,ResponseContent> assertObject(Class<T> type) {
1166      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).as(type);
1167   }
1168
1169   /**
1170    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().as(<jv>type</jv>, <jv>args</jv>)</c>.
1171    *
1172    * @param <T> The object type to create.
1173    * @param type The object type to create.
1174    * @param args Optional type arguments.
1175    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1176    */
1177   public <T> FluentAnyAssertion<Object,ResponseContent> assertObject(Type type, Type...args) {
1178      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).as(type, args);
1179   }
1180
1181   /**
1182    * Returns the response that created this object.
1183    *
1184    * @return The response that created this object.
1185    */
1186   public RestResponse response() {
1187      return response;
1188   }
1189
1190   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1191   // HttpEntity passthrough methods.
1192   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1193
1194   /**
1195    * Tells if the entity is capable of producing its data more than once.
1196    *
1197    * <p>
1198    * A repeatable entity's {@link #getContent()} and {@link #writeTo(OutputStream)} methods can be called more than
1199    * once whereas a non-repeatable entity's can not.
1200    *
1201    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1202    * <li class='note'>This method always returns <jk>true</jk> if the response body is cached (see {@link #cache()}).
1203    * </ul>
1204    *
1205    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the entity is repeatable, <jk>false</jk> otherwise.
1206    */
1207   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1208   public boolean isRepeatable() {
1209      return cached || entity.isRepeatable();
1210   }
1211
1212   /**
1213    * Tells about chunked encoding for this entity.
1214    *
1215    * <p>
1216    * The primary purpose of this method is to indicate whether chunked encoding should be used when the entity is sent.
1217    * <br>For entities that are received, it can also indicate whether the entity was received with chunked encoding.
1218    *
1219    * <p>
1220    * The behavior of wrapping entities is implementation dependent, but should respect the primary purpose.
1221    *
1222    * @return <jk>true</jk> if chunked encoding is preferred for this entity, or <jk>false</jk> if it is not.
1223    */
1224   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1225   public boolean isChunked() {
1226      return entity.isChunked();
1227   }
1228
1229   /**
1230    * Tells the length of the content, if known.
1231    *
1232    * @return
1233    *    The number of bytes of the content, or a negative number if unknown.
1234    *    <br>If the content length is known but exceeds {@link Long#MAX_VALUE}, a negative number is returned.
1235    */
1236   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1237   public long getContentLength() {
1238      return body != null ? body.length : entity.getContentLength();
1239   }
1240
1241   /**
1242    * Obtains the <c>Content-Type</c> header, if known.
1243    *
1244    * <p>
1245    * This is the header that should be used when sending the entity, or the one that was received with the entity.
1246    * It can include a charset attribute.
1247    *
1248    * @return The <c>Content-Type</c> header for this entity, or <jk>null</jk> if the content type is unknown.
1249    */
1250   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1251   public ResponseHeader getContentType() {
1252      return new ResponseHeader("Content-Type", request, response, entity.getContentType());
1253   }
1254
1255   /**
1256    * Obtains the Content-Encoding header, if known.
1257    *
1258    * <p>
1259    * This is the header that should be used when sending the entity, or the one that was received with the entity.
1260    * <br>Wrapping entities that modify the content encoding should adjust this header accordingly.
1261    *
1262    * @return The <c>Content-Encoding</c> header for this entity, or <jk>null</jk> if the content encoding is unknown.
1263    */
1264   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1265   public ResponseHeader getContentEncoding() {
1266      return new ResponseHeader("Content-Encoding", request, response, entity.getContentEncoding());
1267   }
1268
1269   /**
1270    * Returns a content stream of the entity.
1271    *
1272    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1273    *    <li class='note'>This method is equivalent to {@link #asInputStream()} which is the preferred method for fluent-style coding.
1274    *    <li class='note'>This input stream will auto-close once the end of stream has been reached.
1275    *    <li class='note'>It is up to the caller to properly close this stream if not fully consumed.
1276    *    <li class='note'>This method can be called multiple times if the entity is repeatable or the cache flag is set on this object.
1277    *    <li class='note'>Calling this method multiple times on a non-repeatable or cached body will throw a {@link IllegalStateException}.
1278    *       Note that this is different from the HttpClient specs for this method.
1279    * </ul>
1280    *
1281    * @return Content stream of the entity.
1282    */
1283   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1284   public InputStream getContent() throws IOException, UnsupportedOperationException {
1285      return asInputStream();
1286   }
1287
1288   /**
1289    * Writes the entity content out to the output stream.
1290    *
1291    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1292    *    <li class='note'>This method is equivalent to {@link #pipeTo(OutputStream)} which is the preferred method for fluent-style coding.
1293    * </ul>
1294    *
1295    * @param outstream The output stream to write entity content to.
1296    */
1297   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1298   public void writeTo(OutputStream outstream) throws IOException {
1299      pipeTo(outstream);
1300   }
1301
1302   /**
1303    * Tells whether this entity depends on an underlying stream.
1304    *
1305    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1306    * <li class='note'>This method always returns <jk>false</jk> if the response body is cached (see {@link #cache()}.
1307    * </ul>
1308    *
1309    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the entity content is streamed, <jk>false</jk> otherwise.
1310    */
1311   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1312   public boolean isStreaming() {
1313      return cached ? false : entity.isStreaming();
1314   }
1315
1316   /**
1317    * This method is called to indicate that the content of this entity is no longer required.
1318    *
1319    * <p>
1320    * This method is of particular importance for entities being received from a connection.
1321    * <br>The entity needs to be consumed completely in order to re-use the connection with keep-alive.
1322    *
1323    * @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs.
1324    * @deprecated Use standard java convention to ensure resource deallocation by calling {@link InputStream#close()} on
1325    * the input stream returned by {@link #getContent()}
1326    */
1327   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1328   @Deprecated
1329   public void consumeContent() throws IOException {
1330      entity.consumeContent();
1331   }
1332
1333   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1334   // Utility methods
1335   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1336
1337   private BeanContext getBeanContext() {
1338      return parser == null ? BeanContext.DEFAULT : parser.getBeanContext();
1339   }
1340
1341   private <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Class<T> c) {
1342      return getBeanContext().getClassMeta(c);
1343   }
1344
1345   private <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Type type, Type...args) {
1346      return getBeanContext().getClassMeta(type, args);
1347   }
1348
1349   @Override
1350   public String toString() {
1351      try {
1352         return asString();
1353      } catch (RestCallException e) {
1354         return e.getLocalizedMessage();
1355      }
1356   }
1357}
